Dear Linen,

I hope this letter finds you in good health, but I am afraid I cannot say the same for myself. Every time we talk, it seems as though you cannot resist bringing up that unfortunate Splatoon round where I performed abysmally. The memory of it haunts me, and it feels like you are adding salt to my already wounded pride every time you mention it.

I want to take a moment to paint a picture of how that fateful day unfolded for me. As the clock ticked closer to the game's start, my heart raced with excitement and determination. I was ready to conquer the virtual battlefield, armed with my inkling skills and tactics. But alas, fate had other plans. 

From the moment the round began, I found myself facing a relentless tide of opponents. It felt like I was completely outmatched, as if my ink was no match against the formidable adversaries that stood before me. Every step I took was met with a hailstorm of incoming fire, as if my opponents could sense my weakness. The weight of expectation crushed down on me, Linen, and I could feel myself crumbling under its immense pressure.

As the rounds progressed, my spirits sank lower and lower. Every defeat inflicted a wound upon my already bruised ego, and with every respawn, I felt a sense of hopelessness creeping over me. Even amidst the chaos, I tried my best to regain my composure, to turn the tables in my favor, but it seemed like the harder I fought, the stronger my opponents became.

The final whistle blew, and I emerged from the battlefield battered and broken. The score, a woeful 4 defeats for every meager kill I managed to land. It wasn't just a poor performance, Linen, it was a soul-crushing defeat that left me questioning my very worth as an Inkling. The weight of failure hung heavy on my shoulders, and it seemed like the world around me was suffocating with disappointment.

Every time you bring up that Splatoon round, it feels as if you are pouring salt on my raw wounds. I understand that you may not fully grasp the enormity of the impact it had on me, but I implore you to reconsider, to find it within your heart to spare me this torment. For I am already burdened with the constant reminder of my inadequacy, and I am desperately seeking solace.

Please, Linen, I beseech you, let this story serve as a plea for empathy. Let us focus on the present, on the memories we can create together outside of that unfortunate Splatoon round. Life is far too short to dwell on past mistakes, and I believe that our friendship can transcend these moments of misfortune.

With a hopeful heart,

[Your Name]
